revised_title: Discovery of New Poly-Ammonias and Their Transformations
tldr: The author, A.W. Hofmann, discovered new poly-ammonias through reactions involving ethylate of sodium and cyanate of ethyl. These compounds, such as cyantriethyl-diamine and carbotriethyltriamine, have unique properties and can be transformed into other substances like ethylamine and diethylurea. This research expands our understanding of ammonia derivatives and their transformations.
